name: Transhumanism
description: A 21st-century ideology pushing tech—like AI and biohacking—to transcend human limits, dreaming of a post-biological future.

name: Accelerationism
description: A modern ideology betting that turbocharging capitalism or tech will spark radical change—utopia or collapse, take your pick.

name: Panpsychism
description: A revived philosophy suggesting consciousness isn’t just human but hums in all matter—a 21st-century mind-bender.

name: Scientism
description: A 20th-century ideology doubling down in the 21st, crowning science as the ultimate truth-teller over all else.

name: Logical Positivism
description: A 20th-century philosophy slashing untestable ideas as nonsense, still influencing science’s hard-nosed vibe.

name: Structuralism
description: A 20th-century theory decoding culture through hidden patterns, still lurking in linguistics and anthropology.

name: Post-structuralism
description: A late-20th-century twist claiming meaning’s a moving target, feeding into today’s postmodern debates.

name: Semiotics
description: A 20th-century science of signs, thriving in the 21st to unpack ads, memes, and media overload.

name: Analytic Philosophy
description: A 20th-century logic-chopping approach dominating English-speaking academia, still sharp in AI ethics debates.

name: Continental Philosophy
description: A 20th-century European brew of big ideas, fueling 21st-century takes on power, identity, and tech.

name: Rationalism
description: A 19th-century philosophy trusting reason over senses, still kicking in math and AI’s foundations.

name: Empiricism
description: A 19th-century view tying truth to experience, underpinning today’s data-driven science obsession.

name: Critical Rationalism
description: Popper’s 20th-century idea that knowledge grows by debunking, not proving—still guides scientific skepticism.

name: Behaviorism
description: A 20th-century psychology fixated on actions over thoughts, echoing in AI training and ad targeting.

name: Gestalt Psychology
description: A 20th-century theory of seeing wholes over parts, alive in UX design and cognitive science today.

name: Evolutionary Psychology
description: A late-20th-century science tying modern quirks to ancient survival, hot in 21st-century brain studies.

name: Jungian Psychology
description: Jung’s 20th-century dive into archetypes and the unconscious, still inspiring therapy and pop culture.

name: Georgism
description: A 19th-century push to tax land over labor, popping up in 21st-century urban policy chats.

name: Anarcho-capitalism
description: A 20th-century ideology dreaming of a stateless market utopia, buzzing in crypto and libertarian circles.

name: Cybernetics
description: A 20th-century science of systems and feedback, reborn in 21st-century robotics and network theory.

name: Game Theory
description: A 20th-century math of strategy, ruling 21st-century economics, AI, and geopolitics.

name: String Theory
description: A late-20th-century physics gamble on tiny strings, still chasing the holy grail of unification.

name: Chaos Theory
description: A 20th-century discovery of order in disorder, thriving in climate models and market predictions.

name: Object-Oriented Ontology
description: A 21st-century philosophy leveling all things—humans, rocks, code—as equal players in reality.

name: Speculative Realism
description: A 21st-century push to rethink reality beyond human lenses, shaking up philosophy’s cozy habits.

name: Primitivism
description: A 20th-century ideology pining for pre-tech simplicity, resurfacing in off-grid and anti-tech movements.

name: Postcolonialism
description: A 20th-century lens on colonial scars, thriving in 21st-century fights over culture and reparations.

name: Egalitarianism
description: A 19th-century ideal of universal equality, fueling 21st-century battles over rights and wealth gaps.

name: Technological Singularity
description: A 21st-century theory of AI surpassing us, hyped by tech prophets and debated in boardrooms.

name: Biocentrism
description: A 21st-century philosophy hinting life shapes the cosmos, not just the other way around.

name: Deep Ecology
description: A late-20th-century call to value all life equally, loud in 21st-century green activism.

name: Cosmopolitanism
description: A 19th-century vision of global citizenship, reborn in 21st-century borderless dreams.

name: Autonomism
description: A 20th-century radical push for self-rule, alive in 21st-century squats and co-ops.

name: Ecofeminism
description: A 20th-century fusion linking women’s and nature’s liberation, thriving in climate justice today.

name: Libertarian Socialism
description: A 20th-century hybrid of freedom and equality, whispering in 21st-century co-op experiments.

name: Agorism
description: A 20th-century libertarian plot to outmaneuver the state via black markets, buzzing in crypto hubs.

name: Mutualism
description: A 19th-century anarchist trade dream, flickering in 21st-century worker-owned ventures.

name: Solarpunk
description: A 21st-century vision of green tech and beauty, countering dystopia with sustainable hope.

name: Afrocentrism
description: A 20th-century reclaiming of African roots, powering 21st-century cultural pride movements.

name: Pan-Africanism
description: A 20th-century unity call for Africans worldwide, still fueling diaspora politics and pride.

name: Zapatismo
description: A late-20th-century indigenous rebellion in Mexico, inspiring 21st-century anti-globalist fights.

name: Digital Minimalism
description: A 21st-century philosophy slashing tech clutter for focus, a lifeline in the smartphone age.

name: Climate Justice
description: A 21st-century ideology demanding fair fixes for climate change, spotlighting the Global South.

name: Neurodiversity
description: A 21st-century movement celebrating brain differences—autism, ADHD—as natural, not defects.

name: Memetics
description: A late-20th-century theory of ideas as viruses, exploding in 21st-century meme culture analysis.

name: Effective Altruism
description: A 21st-century push to maximize good through data-driven charity, a nerdy twist on do-gooding.

name: Posthumanism
description: A 21st-century philosophy rethinking humanity’s role as tech and nature blur—less ‘us vs. them.’

name: Complexity Theory
description: A 20th-century science of messy systems, thriving in 21st-century climate and AI modeling.

name: Media Ecology
description: A 20th-century theory on how media shapes us, hotter than ever in the digital deluge.

name: Post-Keynesianism
description: A 20th-century economic reboot of Keynes, pushing government muscle in 21st-century crises.

name: Degrowth
description: A 21st-century ideology rejecting endless growth for a smaller, sustainable economy—less is more.

name: Platform Cooperativism
description: A 21st-century fix for gig work—worker-owned digital platforms to ditch corporate overlords.

name: Dataism
description: A 21st-century belief that data flows rule all, from biology to society—algorithms as the new gods.

name: Queer Ecology
description: A 21st-century mash-up of queer theory and nature, challenging straight-and-narrow views of ecosystems.

name: Techno-optimism
description: A 21st-century cheer for tech solving all woes—think Silicon Valley’s sunny gospel.

name: Techno-pessimism
description: A 21st-century gloom warning tech’s runaway train will crash society—dystopia now.

name: Biohacking
description: A 21st-century DIY movement tweaking the body—think implants and gene edits—for peak performance.

name: Universal Basic Income (UBI)
description: A 20th-century idea reborn in the 21st—cash for all, no strings, to fix inequality and AI job loss.

name: Dark Pool Theory
description: A 21st-century conspiracy vibe—secret elites pull strings via hidden networks and tech.

name: Network Theory
description: A 20th-century science of connections, booming in 21st-century social media and epidemiology.

name: Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs)
description: A 21st-century ideology of blockchain-run groups—no bosses, just code and votes.

name: Critical Data Studies
description: A 21st-century lens on how data’s power shapes justice, privacy, and truth—Big Tech under the microscope.

name: Algorithmic Bias
description: A 21st-century theory exposing how AI mirrors human flaws, amplifying racism or sexism in code.

name: Surveillance Capitalism
description: A 21st-century critique of tech giants mining our lives for profit—privacy’s the new battleground.

name: Affect Theory
description: A 20th-century idea of emotions as forces, surging in 21st-century art and politics analysis.

name: New Materialism
description: A 21st-century philosophy giving matter agency—stuff like plastic or code isn’t just passive.

name: Hypernormalization
description: A 21st-century theory of a fake-normal world—power hides chaos behind a bland facade.

name: Permaculture
description: A 20th-century design philosophy for sustainable living, blooming in 21st-century eco-circles.

name: Antinatalism
description: A 21st-century stance against procreation—life’s suffering outweighs its joys, so why start it?

name: Positivism
description: A 19th-century faith in observable facts, still underpinning 21st-century science’s core.

name: Actor-Network Theory
description: A 20th-century idea tying humans and objects in webs of influence, big in 21st-century tech studies.

name: Biopolitics
description: A 20th-century theory of power over bodies and lives, hot in 21st-century health and surveillance debates.

name: Digital Sociology
description: A 21st-century science probing how online life rewires society—think TikTok and tribes.

name: Cyberfeminism
description: A 20th-century feminist take on tech, thriving in 21st-century battles over digital equity.

name: Longtermism
description: A 21st-century ideology prioritizing future generations—billions unborn outweigh us now.

name: Quantum Computing Theory
description: A 21st-century leap in computation, using quantum weirdness to crack impossible problems.

name: Post-scarcity
description: A 21st-century vision where tech abundance kills want—utopia or pipe dream?

name: Disability Justice
description: A 21st-century movement smashing ableism, demanding inclusion beyond mere access.

name: Critical Animal Studies
description: A 21st-century push to rethink human-animal bonds, challenging meat norms and zoos.

name: Speculative Fiction Theory
description: A 20th-century lens on sci-fi as a mirror, booming in 21st-century climate and tech tales.

name: Info-War Theory
description: A 21st-century take on weaponized info—disinfo and hacks as the new battlefield.

name: Resilience Theory
description: A 20th-century idea of bouncing back, key in 21st-century climate and crisis planning.

name: Synthetic Biology
description: A 21st-century science crafting life from scratch—think lab-grown meat and designer bugs.

name: Decolonial Theory
description: A 20th-century push to unravel colonial mindsets, loud in 21st-century global south voices.

name: Techno-libertarianism
description: A 21st-century creed fusing tech innovation with hands-off freedom—think Musk’s vibe.

name: Hyperstition
description: A 21st-century theory of ideas making themselves real—fiction turns fact in a feedback loop.

name: Eco-socialism
description: A 20th-century blend of green and red, pushing collective action for a planet-friendly future.
